i1.name: Adaptive_Defenses
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Periodically, '''Camille's''' next [[basic attack]] against enemy champions is enhanced to {{tip|shield}} her for {{sti|{{as|20% of her '''maximum''' health}}}} for 2 seconds from either exclusively {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} or {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}}, based on which type the target has previously dealt most of against champions as well as on '''Camille's''' '''current''' {{sti|{{as|armor}}}} and {{sti|{{as|magic resistance}}}}.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Periodically, Camille's next basic attack against enemy champions is enhanced to shield her for 20% of her maximum health for 2 seconds from either exclusively physical damage or magic damage, based on which type the target has previously dealt most of against champions as well as on Camille's current armor and magic resistance.
i1.notes:
* ''Adaptive Defenses'' goes on cooldown after the shield expires or is destroyed.
* The shield-typing is determined based on the '''total''' damage the target has dealt to champions that game (as a percentage) versus '''Camille's''' '''current''' {{sti|{{as|armor}}}} and {{sti|{{as|magic resistance}}}}.
** For example, with little '''bonus''' resistances '''Camille''' would likely gain the most obvious shield-typing - i.e. [[Shield#Physical shields|physical shield]] versus champions primarily dealing {{as|physical damage}} and [[Shield#Magic shields|magic shield]] versus champions primarily dealing {{as|magic damage}}. However, if she has a sufficient amount of {{as|armor}} against a champion dealing both alternates of {{as|physical damage}} and {{as|magic damage}}, she will receive a magic shield as the {{as|physical damage}} threat is already being mitigated by her {{as|armor}}, and vice versa.
* The type of shield that will be granted to '''Camille''' when she attacks any one enemy champion is shown as an icon beneath their [[health bar]]: {{as|orange|physical damage}} for physical shield and {{as|blue|magic damage}} for magic shield.
* ''Adaptive Defenses'' takes priority over all other {{tip|shield|shields}} except {{ai|Black Shield|Morgana}}.

q1.name: Precision_Protocol
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille's''' next basic attack within 4 seconds has an {{tip|uncancelable windup}}, gains {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}}, deals {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and grants her {{as|{{sti|movement speed|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for 1 second.
After {{fd|0.25}} seconds, ''Precision Protocol'' can then be recast within the next {{fd|3.5}} seconds at no extra cost.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Camille''' mimics the first cast's effects. If this ability is recast {{fd|1.5}} seconds afer the first attack, then ''Precision Protocol's'' bonus damage is doubled, and {{pp|key=%|40 to 100 for 16|formula=36%+(4%*level). ''Capped at level 16''}} of the attack's total damage will be dealt as {{as|{{sti|true damage}}}}.

Both casts of ''Precision Protocol'' {{tip|basic attack reset|reset}} '''Camille's''' basic attack timer. '''Camille''' is able to cast {{ai|Tactical Sweep|Camille}}, {{ai|Hookshot|Camille}}, or {{ai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}} during either attacks' animation without that attack being cancelled.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille's next basic attack within 4 seconds has an uncancelable windup, gains 50 bonus range, deals bonus physical damage and grants her bonus movement speed for 1 second.
After 0.25 seconds, Precision Protocol can then be recast within the next 3.5 seconds at no extra cost.
Recast: Camille mimics the first cast's effects. If this ability is recast 1.5 seconds afer the first attack, then Precision Protocol's bonus damage is doubled, and 40% âˆ’ 100 for 16% (based on level) of the attack's total damage will be dealt as true damage.
Both casts of Precision Protocol reset Camille's basic attack timer. Camille is able to cast Camille's Tactical Sweep, Camille's Hookshot, or Camille's The Hextech Ultimatum during either attacks' animation without that attack being cancelled.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Physical Damage|{{as|{{ap|20 to 40}}% AD}}}}{{st|Bonus Movement Speed|{{ap|20 to 40}}%}}
q1.notes:
* Both casts count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
* Both enhanced attacks '''cannot''' {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}}.
* The empowered {{sbc|recast}}'s {{tip|true damage}}:
** Has a special case to factor {{tip|Spellblade}} into the true damage conversion of part of her attack's damage.
** Other [[on-hit]] effects do not interact with the true damage conversion.
** Is not amplified by modifiers that do not increase true damage such as {{ri|Coup de Grace}}.
** Is dealt just prior to the physical damage portion of the attack.
* ''Precision Protocol'' applies to [[structures]] but the recast does not convert to true damage.
* The enhanced attack will still complete and hit the target even if they become {{tip|untargetable}} during the {{tip|attack windup|attack's windup}}.

effects.str:
• Bonus Physical Damage: % AD
  • Bonus Movement Speed: %
• Increased Mixed Damage: % AD

w1.name: Tactical_Sweep
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' sweeps her leg to deal {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in a cone in the target direction after a {{fd|1.1}}-second delay, during which she's {{tip|ghosted}} and is unable to declare basic attacks.

Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take {{as|'''additional''' physical damage}}, capped at 300 damage against {{tip|monsters}}, and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 80% decaying over 2 seconds. '''Camille''' is {{tip|healing|healed}} for 100% of this additional damage {{tt|post-mitigation|After modifiers such as resistances}} against enemy {{tip|champions}} in the outer half.
Non-epic monsters take 50% damage from ''Tactical Sweep''.
''Other abilities can be cast during the animation without cancelling it.''
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille sweeps her leg to deal physical damage to all enemies in a cone in the target direction after a 1.1-second delay, during which she's ghosted and is unable to declare basic attacks.
Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take additional physical damage, capped at 300 damage against monsters, and are slowed by 80% decaying over 2 seconds. Camille is healed for 100% of this additional damage post-mitigation against enemy champions in the outer half.
Non-epic monsters take 50% damage from Tactical Sweep.
Other abilities can be cast during the animation without cancelling it.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|70 to 190}} {{as|(+ 60% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Non-Epic Monster Damage|{{ap|70/2 to 190/2}} {{as|(+ 30% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}

{{st|Outer Cone Bonus Damage|{{as|{{ap|5 to 7}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|2.5}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}|Bonus Non-Epic Monster Damage|{{as|{{ap|5/2 to 7/2}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|1.25}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}}}
w1.notes:
* '''Camille''' can move during the delay, but the hitbox and '''Camille's''' visuals are fixed to the initial target direction.
** '''Camille's''' facing-direction, for effects such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}, is the direction she is moving, and not the direction the model is facing.
* The 50% damage reduction against non-epic monsters applies after the cap. Because of this, the actual cap against non-epic monsters is 150 damage.
* Because the increased damage in the outer range of the cone is dealt as an '''additional''' instance of damage (as opposed to '''bonus''' damage to the original instance), it will trigger effects twice such as being reduced by {{ri|Bone Plating}} an extra time.{{bug|2}}
** It still belongs to the same {{tip|cast instance}}, therefore it does not trigger additional stacks of {{ri|Conqueror}} or {{ri|Electrocute}}.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 60% bonus AD)
  • Non-Epic Monster Damage: (+ 30% bonus AD)

• Outer Cone Bonus Damage: % (+ 2.5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
  • Bonus Non-Epic Monster Damage: % (+ 1.25% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health

st_slices: % (+ 2.5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
% (+ 1.25% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health

e1.name: Hookshot
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' fires a grapple in the target direction. If the grapple collides with terrain, '''Camille''' will {{tip|dash}} toward and perch onto the terrain for {{fd|0.75}} seconds. While perched, she gains the ability to cast {{ai|Wall Dive|Camille}}.
'''''Camille''' will be {{tip|knockdown|knocked down}} by any {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} or {{tip|polymorph|polymorphing}} crowd control, excluding {{tip|sleep}}{{bug}}, during the dash.''
''Other abilities can be cast during the ability. Casting {{ai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}} will cause the grapple to disappear if it is in flight.''
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille fires a grapple in the target direction. If the grapple collides with terrain, Camille will dash toward and perch onto the terrain for 0.75 seconds. While perched, she gains the ability to cast Camille's Wall Dive.
Camille will be knocked down by any immobilizing or polymorphing crowd control, excluding sleepUnknown value: bug, during the dash.
Other abilities can be cast during the ability. Casting Camille's The Hextech Ultimatum will cause the grapple to disappear if it is in flight.
e1.notes:
* ''Hookshot'' can be cast while {{tip|root|rooted}} but not while {{tip|ground|grounded}}.
* '''Camille''' will grapple to terrain even if she is {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}}.
* ''Hookshot'' can interact with [[Terrain#Player-Generated|player-generated terrain]].

e2.name: Wall_Dive
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' {{tip|dashes}} in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies near the landing location. ''Wall Dive's'' range is doubled towards enemy {{tip|champions}} within 1400 units. '''Camille''' grants {{tip|ghosted|ghosting}} to non-champions she passes through for 4 seconds.

'''Camille''' stops prematurely upon colliding with an enemy champion, {{tip|airborne|knocking back}} all nearby enemy champions a short distance as well as {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|0.75}} seconds, while also gaining {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} for 5 seconds.
''Wall Dive may be also cast with movement or attack commands. Other abilities besides {{ai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}} can be cast while grappled or during the dash.''
e2.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille dashes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies near the landing location. Wall Dive's range is doubled towards enemy champions within 1400 units. Camille grants ghosting to non-champions she passes through for 4 seconds.
Camille stops prematurely upon colliding with an enemy champion, knocking back all nearby enemy champions a short distance as well as stunning them for 0.75 seconds, while also gaining bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Wall Dive may be also cast with movement or attack commands. Other abilities besides Camille's The Hextech Ultimatum can be cast while grappled or during the dash.
e2.notes:
* ''Wall Dive'' count as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
* Despite what one might assume from a wall-jumping ability, ''Wall Dive'' '''can''' be used to go through terrain (including the terrain she is bound to).
* Casting {{si|Flash}} during ''Wall Dive's'' dash will interrupt it but '''Camille''' will affect enemies around the new location.
* ''Wall Dive'' is disabled while {{tip|grounded}} or {{tip|root|rooted}}.
** ''Wall Dive'' will not automatically cast from movement or attack commands in both cases. While grounded, however, '''Camille''' is able to move while bound. She may still dash away from her current location once the grounding finishes.
* '''Camille''' will only gain a range indicator towards each valid champion within the extended dash range (800), but will still gain the extended dash range without the indicator against enemies within the 1400 range.
** She does not have to {{tip|Sight|see}} any enemy champions to gain the range indicator or extended range.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will not resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Camille''' is bound to terrain:
** When '''Camille''' is interrupted, she will automatically cast ''Wall Dive''. The only exception is if she was interrupted by casting {{si|Flash}} or {{si|Recall}}, in which case ''Wall Dive'' cancels.
{{ct|attack=Initiates the dash towards attack target.|move=Initiates the dash towards the commanded location.|cast={{ai|Precision Protocol|Camille}} and {{ai|Tactical Sweep|Camille}} are usable. {{ai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}} is disabled.|items=interrupts|consume=Interrupts|spells=false,interrupts,false,interrupts,false}}
e2.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  0 as 0 and riot's value 70,70,70,70,70 as 70
e2.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '0' as '0' and riot's value '16,15,14,13,12' as '16/15/14/13/12'

r1.name: The_Hextech_Ultimatum
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' becomes {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|dash|leaps}} with {{tip|displacement immunity}} towards the target enemy {{tip|champion|champion}} over {{fd|0.5}} seconds, {{tip|standard sight|revealing}} them for the duration and {{tip|disrupt|disrupting}} their ongoing {{tip|channel|channels}}.
When '''Camille''' lands, she becomes targetable again and creates a hexagonal zone around her current location for a duration, {{tip|airborne|knocking away}} all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target cannot escape the zone through any means. While within the zone, '''Camille's''' basic attacks deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}.
''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends automatically within 1 second if '''Camille''' leaves the area or dies.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille becomes untargetable and leaps with displacement immunity towards the target enemy champion over 0.5 seconds, revealing them for the duration and disrupting their ongoing channels.
When Camille lands, she becomes targetable again and creates a hexagonal zone around her current location for a duration, knocking away all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target cannot escape the zone through any means. While within the zone, Camille's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage.
The Hextech Ultimatum ends automatically within 1 second if Camille leaves the area or dies.
r1.notes:
* The {{tip|disrupt}} is 'nested' into a {{fd|0.4}}-second {{tip|Silence|Silence debuff}} on the target, but unlike normal silences, this debuff does not actually make the target ''unable to cast''. Instead, this makes sure that the ''disrupt'' is prevented by {{tip|Cc-immune|immunity to silences}}.
* While the target is affected by ''The Hextech Ultimatum'', they cannot use {{si|Flash}}.
* '''Camille''' will attempt to basic attack the target upon landing.
* '''Camille''' will track the target if they change locations.
** She will always land and create the zone after {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
* If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, {{tip|death|dies}}, or moves {{tt|2000|Estimated}} or more units away during the dash, it will be interrupted and the ability's {{sti|cooldown}} and {{sti|{{as|mana}}}} cost will not be refunded.
* {{tip|Airborne|Knockaway}} speed is 1000.
* If the target manages to be outside of the boundaries, they will immediately be pulled back towards the center of the hexagon.
* The boundaries are not considered terrain ({{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}} exception), and enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside.
** {{tip|Dash|Dashes}}, {{tip|blink|blinks}}, {{tip|airborne|displacements}}, and other forms of movement will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.
** {{cai|Chronobreak|Ekko}} will still deal damage at the hologram's location.
** An active {{ai|Cease and Desist|Vi}} on a target outside the perimeter will cause {{ci|Vi}} to continue her charge until ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends. She can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.
** If the target {{tip|attached|attaches}} to a unit, they will only be displaced back inside once they detach. ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' does not end nor break the bind to the victim. 
*** {{cai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}} allows him to cast it even if his target is outside the area, dashing through the borders and attaching despite being unable to escape.
*** {{cai|You and Me!|Yuumi}} allows her to bypass the borders if the unit she attaches to leaves the area.
*** {{cai|The Show Stopper|Sett}} does not allow him to pass through the borders and the dash will end prematurely when he encounters them.
**** If the target of {{ai|The Show Stopper|Sett}} is also the target of ''The Hextech Ultimatum'', they can go through the borders while attached to him.
* If '''Camille''' enters {{tip|resurrection}} during the initial cast, the {{tip|dash}} is stopped and the zone is formed immediately.
** ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends if the target enters ''resurrection'', but not if '''Camille''' does.
* ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends immediately if the target is dragged by {{ai|Fear Beyond Death 2|Urgot|Fear Beyond Death}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Camille''' is dashing.
{{ct|attack=false|cast=false|move=false|items=false|consume=false|spells=false|interrupts=death}}

effects.str: • Bonus Magic Damage: (+ % of target's current health)
